Class TextField

java.lang.Object
  greenfoot.Actor
      GUIComponent
          TextField

public class TextField
extends GUIComponent

Class TextField is a Greenfoot component that allows the user to enter a single line of text. When users are finished entering text, they can signal they are finished by pressing the Enter key. Pressing the Enter key will fire the ActionListener interface. The ActionListener interface is like the ActionListener interface in Java Swing. Scenarios using the ActionListener callback must include the ActionListener interface, and the class listening for button clicks must implement that interface. In addition, the implementing class must add itself to the callback list by calling the addActionListener() method. Then when the Enter key is pressed, the actionPerformed() method in the listening class will be called. The developer can read the text the user entered by calling the getText() method.

Version:
1.0 12/28/2010
Author:
Ed Parrish
See Also:
http://java.sun.com/developer/onlineTraining/Media/2DText/index.html

repaint

public void repaint()
Paints the component image, including the background, border and text. This method recreates the text layout. To repaint without recreating the text layout, call super.repaint().
